column2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi To Lay Foundation For Ntpc’S New Power Project In Chhattisgarh
column5: RAIPUR: India’s largest integrated power utility, NTPC Limited is embarking on a major stride towards strengthening the Central India's energy landscape with the development of the Sipat Super Thermal Power Project, Stage-III located in Bilaspur district of Chhattisgarh, with an investment of Rs 9791 crore. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the 800 MW pit-head power project on Mar 30.The project is being established with an investment of Rs 9791 Crore within the available land of Sipat Super Thermal Power Station premises. The commissioning of Sipat III – (1x800 MW) power plant will bring the total installed capacity of Sipat STPS to an impressive 3,780 MW. This plant will address increasing power demands in the Central Region of the country, i.e. Chhattisgarh as home state and other beneficiary states such as Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Goa. The Sipat-III boasts state-of-the-art Ultra Supercritical technology, which enhances fuel efficiency and reduces emissions. Besides the project aligns with NTPC's broader strategy to upgrade its power plants and transition to more eco-friendly and efficient energy solutions, all while maintaining a reliable supply of electricity. column2: Gujarat 2036 Olympic Dreams: Rape-Convict Asaram Ashram To Turn Into Sporting Arena
column5: AHMEDABAD: As a master plan for the creation of Olympic facilities for the 2036 Games is being prepared, the land of three ashrams, including rape-convict Asaram's ashram in Motera, is set to be acquired for the Sardar Patel Sports Enclave, Olympic Village, and other sports facilities coming up on approximately 650 acres of land near the present Narendra Modi Stadium at Motera, sources close to the development said.Top sources said that three ashrams, namely Sant Shree Asaram Ashram, Bhartiya Seva Samaj, and Sadashiv Pragya Mandal, are likely to be shifted. The process to acquire these land parcels and provide alternative sites to the three trusts is underway, sources said. A three-member committee, including the Ahmedabad municipal commissioner, Ahmedabad district collector, and Auda CEO, has initiated the land acquisition process for the master plan, sources detailed.PollDo you think Gujarat is ready to host the Olympics in 2036?No, too many challenges to overcomeNot sure, needs more developmentAbsolutely, it's a great opportunity"With regards to the Sant Shree Asaram Ashram, Bhartiya Seva Samaj, and Sadashiv Pragya Mandal, the collector's office will complete pending proceedings in accordance with the law. The Land Parcel Finalisation Committee will decide on providing alternative land or compensation for constructions. Sadashiv Pragya Mandal has requested to retain structures at their current locations. The master plan may accommodate this, subject to cooperation in handing over other land parcels," top sources close to the development said.The residential localities like Shivnagar and Vanzara Vaas near the stadium have also been included in the master plan. On February 20, 2025, a committee led by Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel decided that the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) would relocate the occupants. The Ahmedabad Collector's office has been tasked with the acquisition process.According to AUDA sources, an international consultancy agency, Populous, is preparing the master plan for the Sardar Patel Sports Enclave and Olympic Village. The agency has selected land for the master plan, and a preliminary report is ready. The plan includes 600 acres in Bhat, Motera, Koteshwar, and Sughad, along with 50 acres on the Sabarmati Riverfront, totalling 650 acres. The master plan also considers land from the Karai Police Academy. The consultant agency has incorporated land from Phase 2 of the Sabarmati Riverfront into the plan. The enclave will be established on 280 acres around the Narendra Modi Stadium and 50 acres on the riverfront, while the Olympic Village will be set up on 240 acres in Bhat and Sughad. Sports facilities are also planned for the Karai Academy land.AUDA sources state that earmarking of the land around the Narendra Modi Stadium is complete, and the preliminary master plan, including land to be acquired, is ready. "Private plots will be acquired through TP schemes, and leased lands given by the state, including those of the three ashrams, will be taken back. The issue of providing alternative sites for these ashrams is under consideration," AUDA sources said.Stay updated with the latest city news, Air Quality Index (AQI), and weather updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

column2: Yogi Adityanath Most Suitable To Succeed Narendra Modi As Pm, Says Bjp Mla
column5: LUCKNOW: Even as BJP celebrated the completion of eight years of its govt in UP on Monday, its MLA from Gopamau, Shyam Prakash, pitched for CM Yogi Adityanath as the "most suitable successor" to PM Narendra Modi in the coming years."The entire Hindu community wants Yogi to succeed Modi. Once that happens, the Yogi model of governance would be repeated in the entire country," Prakash told TOI. He termed Yogi as a neta who represents the aspirations of the Hindu community.Prakash said that hoisting the Hindutva flag was the need of the hour, which Yogi has consistently done as a party leader. "Taking a hardline stance is a requisite from the point of politics. It is also in consonance with the feelings of several Hindus," he said.Prakash's statement came two days after he said that deputy CM Keshav Maurya should take over from "baba" (a reference to Yogi), who should "go to Delhi". He said Maurya's ascendency as UP CM would fulfil the "aspiration of thousands of people from the backward classes".The five-term Dalit MLA is a known turncoat. He represented the Ahirori reserved seat in 1996 and 2004 as a BSP MLA. In 2012, he switched to SP, winning from the Gopamau seat in Hardoi. In 2017, Prakash joined the saffron bandwagon, winning from the same seat for the next two consecutive terms.Experts said Prakash's statement reflects a growing sentiment among some BJP supporters about the future leadership of the party. By proposing Yogi's name as Modi's successor, the MLA is aligning with BJP's Hindu-centric identity, represented by leaders like Yogi, an analyst said.
column6: It is also in consonance with the feelings of several Hindus," he said.Prakash's statement came two days after he said that deputy CM Keshav Maurya should take over from "baba" (a reference to Yogi), who should "go to Delhi". He represented the Ahirori reserved seat in 1996 and 2004 as a BSP MLA.

column2: Saha Praises Pm For Ensuring Even & Equitable Devpt Model
column5: Agartala: Tripura chief minister Manik Saha applauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his effort to ensure even and equitable development of Indian states while addressing a gathering on the celebration of Bihar Day here.Saha said under Modi's leadership, Tripura has emerged as a leading state in the northeast, marking the beginning of a new chapter in development. "Each of the states in the East and the northeast is experiencing a balanced growth of development and the Prime Minister has erased all disparities," he said.He claimed Tripura has the second-highest GSDP in the northeast and his govt has been working towards development in line with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Viksit Bharat vision. The celebration of Bihar Day in Tripura signifies it, he said."I pursued my medical studies at a college in Patna for five years. I realised to become a mature individual, one needs to spend at least 4-5 years in Bihar. It produced a large number of IAS and IPS officers for the country, and many of them are proudly working in Tripura. Almost all top-level officials in our state administration hail from Bihar," Saha said."Prime Minister Narendra Modi is committed to building a developed Bihar, and whatever he promises, he delivers," he said.
column6: Agartala: Tripura chief minister Manik Saha applauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his effort to ensure even and equitable development of Indian states while addressing a gathering on the celebration of Bihar Day here.Saha said under Modi's leadership, Tripura has emerged as a leading state in the northeast, marking the beginning of a new chapter in development. Almost all top-level officials in our state administration hail from Bihar," Saha said.

column2: Gir, Barda Wildlife Sanctuaries See Surge In Visitors
column5: Ahmedabad: The Gujarat govt on Thursday said that the number of tourists visiting Gir increased by 18.8% over the past 20 days.According to official figures, following Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Gir visit, tourist numbers rose to 59,009 from 49,681 in the preceding 20-day period, marking an 18.8% increase in visitor footfall.The govt heightened tourist interest in Porbandar district's Barda Wildlife Sanctuary, the alternative home for Asiatic lions. Visitor numbers for Barda Safari doubled from 108 in Feb to 215 in March.Officials highlight that Barda's environment mirrors Gir's protected zone, sharing comparable habitat, geography, and terrain features. The sanctuary plays a vital role in lion gene pool preservation. Records show the last lion group sighting in Barda occurred in 1879, after which the species vanished from the region. column2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi And Union Ministers To Attend Vicky Kaushal Starrer 'Chhaava' Screening In Parliament
column5: Parliament is set to screen the Hindi film 'Chhaava', which tells the story of Maratha ruler Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, at the Balayogi Auditorium in the Parliament library building this Thursday, according to a report in News 18.Prime Minister Narendra Modi, union ministers, and MPs are set to attend the special screening of 'Chhaava'. The entire cast and crew, including actor Vicky Kaushal, who plays Sambhaji Maharaj, are also expected to be present. This follows a month after the Prime Minister praised the film for depicting the life, bravery, and suffering endured by the Maratha ruler at the hands of Aurangzeb.“It is Maharashtra and Mumbai that have elevated both Marathi and Hindi cinema. These days, Chhaava is creating a buzz across the country (In dino to Chhaava ki dhoom machi hui hai). The portrayal of Sambhaji Maharaj’s courage in this way has been inspired by Shivaji Sawant’s Marathi novel,” PM Modi remarked on February 21 during his address at the Akhil Bharatiya Marathi Sahitya Sammelan in the national capital.'Chhaava' is based on the life of Maratha ruler Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj, showcasing his bravery, resilience, and the torture he endured at the hands of Aurangzeb. Starring Vicky Kaushal in the lead role, the film has garnered attention for its historical accuracy and emotional depth. Since its release on February 14, 2025, it has been widely appreciated and continues to perform well at the box office even in its sixth week.According to Sacnilk, 'Chhaava' saw a 31% increase in collections on Sunday, earning Rs 4.8 crore, bringing its total to Rs 583.35 crore in India. The film had an 18.85% Hindi occupancy that day. Globally, it has earned Rs 780 crore, including Rs 90.50 crore from overseas.Interestingly, this report comes just days after the film was blamed for allegedly sparking the recent Nagpur violence. Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis commented that 'Chhaava' has "ignited people's anger against Aurangzeb," suggesting a link between the film's narrative and the subsequent violence. However, netizens and fans defended the movie and slammed reports linking the two.
column6: The entire cast and crew, including actor Vicky Kaushal, who plays Sambhaji Maharaj, are also expected to be present. column2: Talks For Us Trade Deal Progressing Well: Piyush Goyal
column5: New Delhi: Talks for the proposed bilateral trade deal between India and the US are progressing “well” and will be for the “good” of both countries while protecting domestic interests, commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal said Thursday.The minister, who is spearheading the dialogue after PM Narendra Modi and US president Donald Trump agreed to launch the negotiations, said that he was in constant dialogue with the industry — from agriculture, engineering, electronics to textiles, and various interest groups.All are “very” excited about a potential bilateral trade agreement with the US, he said, adding, “The discussions are ongoing. They are progressing well and will be for the good of both the United States and India”.When asked whether Indian industry should tighten its seat belt and whether there will be any turbulence on April 2, the commerce minister said the India growth story will be intact and the country will continue to power the global economy.“India, under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will continue to steer its economy with our motto of India first. And we are very, very committed and confident that we will take India in the Amrit Kaal to become a global superpower.“Turbulence may come on the flight, but the pilot and the commander has complete control of the situation, and the flight will not only land safely, but will have many, many more journeys of successful growth of successful flights and we will reach our destination of Viksit Bharat 2047,” he added.Stay updated with the latest India news, weather, and Air Quality Index (AQI) updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

column2: Congress' Karti P Chidambaram Meets Pm Modi To Raise Alarm Over Stray Dog Crisis
column5: Karti P Chidambram meets PM Modi (Image taken from X handle) NEW DELHI: Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram met Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his Parliament House office on Friday to discuss the escalating health and safety concerns posed by growing stray dog population."India has over 6.2 crore stray dogs, making it one of the largest populations globally," Chidambaram said in a post on X after the meeting. "With the country accounting for 36 percent of the world’s rabies-related deaths, the situation demands immediate attention."He pointed to the fact that while the Animal Birth Control (ABC) Rules, 2023, were introduced to regulate stray dog populations, implementation has been weak. "I raised concerns about the inadequacy of the current system, where local bodies lack the resources, funding, and technology to tackle this issue effectively. It’s clear that urgent action is required," he added to his statement.To address the issue, Chidambaram further revealed that he proposed the creation of a National Task Force to develop a "holistic, humane, and scientific solution" in collaboration with local authorities. He also stressed the need for dedicated shelter homes and a long-term strategy to tackle the problem.Stay updated with the latest India news, weather, and Air Quality Index (AQI) updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

It’s clear that urgent action is required," he added to his statement.To address the issue, Chidambaram further revealed that he proposed the creation of a National Task Force to develop a "holistic, humane, and scientific solution" in collaboration with local authorities.

column2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi To Unveil Projects Worth Rs 33,700 Crore In Chhattisgarh On Mar 30
column5: Bhopal, March 28 (IANS) Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to unveil a transformative wave of development in Bilaspur, Chhattisgarh, with projects worth over Rs 33,700 crore spanning power, energy, transportation, education, and housing. RAIPUR:Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Chhattisgarh’s Bilaspur district on Mar 30 where he would hold a public meeting at Mohbhatha village and is expected to launch several key development projects.  Chhattisgarh Chief Minister, Vishnu Deo Sai visited the venue for PM’s public meeting in Bilaspur for inspection. According to the office of PM, Narendra Modi is scheduled to travel to Bilapur around 3.30 om where he will lay the foundation stone, initiate commencement of work and dedicate to the nation multiple development projects worth over Rs 33,700 crore.  In a step to make Chhattisgarh self-reliant in power generation, Modi will lay the foundation stone of NTPC’s Sipat Super Thermal Power Project Stage-III (1x800MW), in Bilaspur district, worth over Rs 9,790 crore. This pit head project is based on the latest state of the art ultra-supercritical technology with high power generation efficiency. He will initiate the commencement of work of first super critical thermal power project (2X660MW) of Chhattisgarh State Power Generation Company Limited (CSPGCL) worth over Rs 15,800 crore.  Modi will also dedicate to the nation three Power Transmission projects of Power Grid under Western Region Expansion Scheme (WRES) worth over Rs 560 crore. In line with India’s net-zero emission goals, reducing air pollution and providing cleaner energy solutions, Prime Minister will lay the foundation stone of City Gas Distribution (CGD) project of Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd (BPCL) in Koriya, Surajpur, Balrampur and Surguja districts.  According to information, it includes over 200 km high pressure pipeline and over 800 km MDPE (Medium Density Polyethylene) pipeline and multiple CNG dispensing outlets worth over Rs 1,285 crore.  Modi will also lay the foundation stone of Visakh-Raipur Pipeline (VRPL) Project of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd (HPCL) spanning 540 km worth over Rs 2210 crore. This multiproduct (Petrol, Diesel, Kerosene) pipeline will have a capacity of over 3 million metric tonne per annum. With a focus on improving connectivity in the region, Prime Minister will lay the foundation stone of seven railway projects with a total length of 108 km and dedicate to the nation three railway projects with a total length of 111 km, worth over Rs 2,690 crore. He will flag off the MEMU train service in the Abhanpur- Raipur section via Mandir Hasaud.  PM will also dedicate 100% electrification of the rail network of Indian Railways in Chhattisgarh. These projects will reduce congestion, improve connectivity, and enhance social and economic growth across the region. Enhancing the road infrastructure in the region, Prime Minister will dedicate to the nation the upgraded Jhalmala to Sherpar section of NH-930 (37 Km) and Ambikapur-Pathalgaon section of NH-43 (75 Km) to two lane with paved shoulder. Prime Minister will also lay the foundation stone for the upgradation of Kondagaon- Narayanpur section of NH-130D(47.5Km) to two lane with paved shoulder. These projects worth over Rs 1,270 crore will significantly improve accessibility to tribal and industrial regions leading to holistic development of the region, officials said. Prime Minister will also dedicate two flagship educational initiatives, 130 PM SHRI Schools across 29 districts in the state and Vidya Samiksha Kendra (VSK) at Raipur. These schools will help in providing high-quality education through well-structured infrastructure, smart boards, modern laboratories, and libraries.  In a review meeting, CM Sai directed officials to ensure all preparations for the massive event covering 55 acres of land are completed in an organized, timely manner. Stay updated with the latest city news, Air Quality Index (AQI), and weather updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

Prime Minister will also dedicate two flagship educational initiatives, 130 PM SHRI Schools across 29 districts in the state and Vidya Samiksha Kendra (VSK) at Raipur.

column2: Prime Minister Narendra Modi To Launch Major Power And Aviation Projects In Haryana On April 14
column5: 123 Chandigarh: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Haryana on April 14 to inaugurate two major projects for the state. These include the foundation stone laying of a new 800 MW unit at the Deenbandhu Chaudhary Chhotu Ram Thermal Power Plant in Yamunanagar, built at a cost of Rs 7,272.06 crore, and the launch of air services from Maharaja Agrasen Airport in Hisar, announced Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini on Monday.Saini said that a state-level event will be held to commemorate the birth anniversary of Babasaheb Dr B R Ambedkar.The CM said that the Union ministry of power had granted approval to Haryana Power Generation Corporation Limited (HPGCL) for the establishment of the third unit at the Yamunanagar-based thermal power plant. This new project is an expansion of the existing 2×300 MW units at the facility. The project has a completion deadline of 52 months, with commercial operations expected to commence within 48 months.Once operational, the 800 MW unit will bring Haryana's domestic power generation capacity to 3,382 MW. Currently, the state has an installed power capacity of approximately 14,000 MW, of which 2,582 MW is generated by HPGCL. This project has already received clearance from the Union ministry of environment, forest, and climate change, as well as approval from the Haryana State Pollution Control Board, said Saini.In addition, PM Modi will inaugurate air services from Maharaja Agrasen Airport in Hisar. An integrated aviation hub is being developed over 7,200 acres in Hisar, with 4,200 acres allocated for the airport and 3,000 acres dedicated to an integrated manufacturing cluster. The airport's development is divided into three phases. The first phase, which includes a terminal building, has already been completed at a cost of Rs 50 crore. The second phase includes a 3,000-meter-long runway that allows for the operation of Airbus aircraft with up to 180 passengers, as stated by Saini.On June 13, 2024, a memorandum of understanding (MoU) was signed with Alliance Air to start air services to five cities: Ayodhya, Jammu, Jaipur, Ahmedabad, and Chandigarh. The Airports Authority of India (AAI) applied for a licence from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Jan 23 and received the licence on March 13.MSID:: 119428913 413 |

column2: From Hot Water Only To 1-Fruit Diet, This Is How Pm Narendra Modi Stays Fit And Active At The Age Of 74
column5: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has always been vocal about his healthy eating habits. From moringa paratha to immunity-boosting kadha, he swears by all healthy foods to lead a healthy lifestyle. In the most recently aired Lex Fridman postcast, he opened about his fitness routine and his daily food habits.Stressing on the importance of fasting he said that fasting "never slows me down". 74-year-old Modi, added, “I work just as much as usual. Sometimes, I even work more. And another fascinating thing I’ve noticed is that when I need to express my thoughts, I’m amazed at where they come from and how they flow. It’s truly an incredible experience. Fasting for me is devotion, fasting for me is self-discipline.”During the podcast chat, he mentioned about the tradition of Chaturmas and how the season defines his food habits and fitness routine. PM Modi said that he eats only a single meal within 24 hours between mid-June and November. He added, For about four to four and a half months, I follow this tradition of eating only once in 24 hours.And during the Shardiya Navratri, he “completely” abstains from food and only drinks hot water. He said, “Although drinking hot water has always been a part of my daily routine, my past lifestyle was such that I naturally developed this habit over time."As per the podcast, during Chaitra Navratri, he eats only one specific fruit, once a day. He added in the conversation. "So for those nine days, if let’s say I choose papaya, then for all nine days, I won’t touch anything else. Just papaya. That too, I eat only once a day. That’s how I follow my nine-day fasting routine. So there are numerous fasts I keep throughout the year, and this has become a deeply ingrained tradition in my life. Perhaps I can say that I’ve been following these practices for 50 to 55 years."Benefits of drinking hot waterDrinking hot water is said to improve digestion by stimulating the digestive tract and breaking down food more efficiently. Hot water also aids in detoxification, flushing out toxins and improving kidney function. It can boost metabolism and support weight loss by increasing calorie burning. Additionally, warm water soothes sore throats, relieves nasal congestion, and promotes relaxation, making it beneficial for respiratory health.Side effects of drinking hot waterIt is said that drinking extremely hot water can burn your tongue, throat, and esophagus, causing irritation or long-term damage. Also, regular consumption of very hot water may weaken tooth enamel, leading to increased sensitivity.Benefits of fruit dietA fruit-based diet is packed with essential vitamins, minerals, fiber, and antioxidants, offering numerous health benefits including boosting immunity, aids weight loss, improves digestion, supports heart health, and also detoxifies the body.Disclaimer: When it comes to dietary changes, every body is very subjective and one should always consult a certified nutritionist or medical practitioner before making any changes.
column6: So there are numerous fasts I keep throughout the year, and this has become a deeply ingrained tradition in my life. Also, regular consumption of very hot water may weaken tooth enamel, leading to increased sensitivity.Benefits of fruit dietA fruit-based diet is packed with essential vitamins, minerals, fiber, and antioxidants, offering numerous health benefits including boosting immunity, aids weight loss, improves digestion, supports heart health, and also detoxifies the body.Disclaimer: When it comes to dietary changes, every body is very subjective and one should always consult a certified nutritionist or medical practitioner before making any changes.

column2: Rameshwaram: Pm Narendra Modi To Inaugurate India’S First Vertical Lift Sea Bridge On Ram Navami
column5: In a significant event slated for April 6, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Rameshwaram, Tamil Nadu, to mark the occasion of Ram Navmi with prayers at the revered Ramanathswamy Temple. Prime Minister Modi will also inaugurate the newly constructed Pamban Bridge, a modern engineering marvel set to replace the century-old structure that once connected the mainland to this sacred island.The new Pamban Bridge is a project hailed as a milestone in India’s infrastructure development.The new Pamban Bridge, stretching over 2.5 kilometers, has been constructed at a cost of INR 535 crore by Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL). It succeeds the original Pamban Rail Bridge, a historic structure built in 1914 that served as a vital link between mainland India and Rameshwaram for 105 years. The old bridge, however, was decommissioned in December 2022 after severe corrosion rendered it unsafe, prompting the need for a modern replacement.Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw described the new bridge as “India’s first vertical lift railway sea bridge.” As per reports, the new Pamban Bridge is engineered to accommodate faster trains and increased traffic, ensuring enhanced connectivity for the region.Also read: Kainchi Dham in Nainital introduces shuttle service to solve traffic issuesThe old Pamban Bridge, an iconic cantilever structure, had long been a testament to early 20th-century engineering. However, after more than a century of exposure to the harsh marine environment, its closure in 2022 marked the end of an era. The new bridge, with its vertical lift mechanism, promises greater durability and efficiency, aligning with India’s push for modernized rail networks.Railway officials and local leaders have expressed enthusiasm for the project, noting its potential to streamline travel and transport. Rameshwaram, an island steeped in mythology and history, stands to benefit from improved access, boosting tourism and local economies while preserving its sanctity.Also read: 5 islands that are permanently off-limits to touristsAs the date approaches, preparations are underway in Rameshwaram to welcome Prime Minister Modi and celebrate the dual highlights of Ram Navmi and the bridge’s opening. The new Pamban Bridge, with its towering presence over the Palk Strait, is on its way to become one of the most unique features for the coastal town of Rameshwaram.

column2: Shubman Gill Becomes Second-Fastest To 1000 Ipl Runs At A Venue
column5: Gujarat Titans captain Shubman Gill (PTI Photo) NEW DELHI: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Shubman Gill etched his name in the record books during the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 clash against Mumbai Indians at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Saturday. The stylish right-hander became the second-fastest batter to score 1000 IPL runs at a single venue, achieving the milestone in just 20 innings.Also See: MI vs GT Live ScoreGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Gill now stands only behind Chris Gayle, who reached 1000 IPL runs in 19 innings at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. David Warner is third on the list, having accomplished the feat in 22 innings at Hyderabad’s Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, followed by Shaun Marsh, who took 26 innings at Mohali. Fewest innings for 1000 IPL runs at a venue19 - Chris Gayle at Bengaluru20 - Shubman Gill at Ahmedabad*22 - David Warner at Hyderabad26 - Shaun Marsh at MohaliDuring the match, Gill and Sai Sudharsan provided a flying start, propelling GT to 66/0 in the powerplay, marking the first wicketless first-innings powerplay of the season.After achieving the feat, Gill was soon dismissed by his counterpart MI skipper Hardik Pandya in the ninth over. Gill scored 38 off 27 balls, which included one six and four boundaries, as the GT openers added 78 runs in 8.3 overs.Get the latest IPL 2025 updates on Times of India, including match schedules, team squads, points table and IPL live score for CSK, MI, RCB, KKR, SRH, LSG, DC, GT, PBKS, and RR. column2: Museum At Bandora To Glorify Role Of Freedom Fighters From Tribal Community
column5: Panaji: The tourism department has finally set the ball rolling for the construction of the long-delayed Tribal Museum for freedom fighters at Bandora, Ponda. It appointed Fourth Dimension Architect Ptv Ltd as the consultant for the project, which is estimated to cost Rs 19.3 crore to build.The tourism department outlined plans to build the museum on land that the department already owns. The museum will include an exhibit area where artefacts and art on the lives of unsung freedom fighters from the tribal community will be displayed.The museum will include an auditorium for 160 persons, an open-air amphitheatre, a library where literature on tribal freedom fighters will be available, and a storage area where other artefacts can be stored.Department officials said that the museum could take 12 to 18 months to build. According to a report prepared by the Standing Committee on Social Justice and Empowerment, Goa is not the only state to delay the construction of the Tribal Museum. Close to ten years after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the setting up of museums to honour tribal freedom fighters, of the 11 that were approved, many remain incomplete, and work has not even begun on three of them.During his Independence Day speech in 2016, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that the govt would build museums to showcase the lives of tribal freedom fighters. However, though the Centre sanctioned Rs 15 crore for the project, the lack of information delayed the project.The museum is supposed to celebrate the lives of the tribal community, tribal art and culture, their folklores, lifestyle, and artefacts. The department of Tribal Welfare launched a study to gather information from the tribal community, but the study missed multiple deadlines.The Union ministry for tribal affairs recommended that the museums should use virtual reality, augmented reality, 3D, and 7D holographic projection to commemorate the lives of the tribal freedom fighters.Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri Wishes, Eid Messages and quotes !

Close to ten years after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the setting up of museums to honour tribal freedom fighters, of the 11 that were approved, many remain incomplete, and work has not even begun on three of them.During his Independence Day speech in 2016, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that the govt would build museums to showcase the lives of tribal freedom fighters.

column2: President, Pm & Others Greet People Of State
column5: Patna: President Droupadi Murmu, Prime Minister Narendra Modi and others on Saturday greeted people on Bihar Diwas. The PM said no effort would be spared for the all-round development of the state, which has been at the centre of Indian traditions and culture.In a post on X, Modi described Bihar as a sacred land of brave and great personalities. The state has lent pride to India's history and its hard working and talented people are a key partner in the ongoing important phase in its development journey, he said.President Murmu wrote on X, "I extend my heartfelt greetings to all the residents of the state on Bihar Day. The land of Bihar has been a centre of knowledge and development since ancient times. I believe that the residents of Bihar will continue to contribute to the creation of a developed Bihar and a developed India on the strength of their talent, determination and hard work."Union home minister Amit Shah also extended his wishes on Monday to the people of Bihar on the state's foundation day. In a post on X, Shah wrote. "Warmest wishes to all Biharis on Bihar Diwas! Bihar, the land of knowledge, tradition and cultural heritage, has always provided leadership and new energy to the country. From glorious chapters in history to the construction of modern India, Bihar has left its indelible mark in every field. Under the guidance of Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, the NDA government is committed to taking Bihar to new heights of progress, prosperity, and self-reliance. I wish for the happiness, peace and prosperity of the people of the state (sic)."The state was carved out of the then Bengal presidency in 1912 on this day.
column6: The state has lent pride to India's history and its hard working and talented people are a key partner in the ongoing important phase in its development journey, he said.President Murmu wrote on X, "I extend my heartfelt greetings to all the residents of the state on Bihar Day. Under the guidance of Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi, the NDA government is committed to taking Bihar to new heights of progress, prosperity, and self-reliance.

column2: Saini Unveils ‘One Time Settlement Scheme’ To Boost Tax Collection
column5: 12 Chandigarh: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini on Sunday said a transparent and equitable taxation system was essential for economic prosperity and good governance in the state. If the tax system is simple and effective, then traders, entrepreneurs, and investors benefit, and economic activities grow rapidly, said Saini. The CM was speaking as the chief guest at a function organised for the launch of the ‘One Time Settlement Scheme – 2025' in Kurukshetra. Saini said the OTS scheme would provide great relief to thousands of taxpayers, especially small shopkeepers, entrepreneurs, and traders. This scheme will give an opportunity to taxpayers to make a new beginning by freeing them from the old financial burden, he said.The scheme is for those taxpayers of Haryana who could not pay the outstanding amount of their taxes due to various reasons. Under this scheme, taxpayers with dues up to Rs 10 lakh will get a rebate of up to Rs 1 lakh, he added. Notably, Saini had made an announcement regarding the OTS scheme in his budget speech last week. Saini said the scheme would remain in force for the coming 180 days.The CM, meanwhile, said the state govt had started a dispute resolution programme to address the problems of the people from all sections of society. Under the programme, various departments have started schemes with different names. The ‘One Time Settlement Scheme – 2025' is also a part of the initiative, he said. The excise and taxation department of Haryana has been facing great difficulty in recovering the outstanding taxes due to various reasons. Therefore, we implemented the ‘One Time Settlement Scheme' to reduce the outstanding taxes and litigation and expedite the recovery of outstanding amounts. While implementing this scheme will provide relief to taxpayers, it will also increase the revenue collection, Saini added. As per information, the govt has created three slabs for the payment of outstanding taxes for the convenience of taxpayers. For payment of cumulative assessed outstanding tax up to Rs 10 lakh, the taxpayer will have to pay 40% of the amount after deducting the exemption of up to Rs 1 lakh. For cumulative assessed outstanding tax liabilities of more than Rs 10 lakh and up to Rs 10 crore, the taxpayer will have to pay 50% of the amount. Similarly, the taxpayer will have to pay 100% of the cumulative assessed outstanding tax liabilities of more than Rs 10 crore.The CM said other suggestions received include GST exemption on agricultural equipment, automation of GST refund, annual self-assessment instead of monthly, and increasing the limit of issuing bills from Rs 5 crore to Rs 10 crore. The Haryana govt will recommend these suggestions to the GST council, he said. MSID:: 119381098 413 |
column6: Saini said the OTS scheme would provide great relief to thousands of taxpayers, especially small shopkeepers, entrepreneurs, and traders. Notably, Saini had made an announcement regarding the OTS scheme in his budget speech last week.

column2: Vijay Deverakonda, Yami Gautam, Amit Sadh Meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi
column5: (Picture Courtesy: Facebook) South superstar Vijay Deverakonda, along with Bollywood actors Yami Gautam and Amit Sadh, had the privilege of meeting the Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, on Friday in New Delhi.Narendra Modi attended the TV9 Summit, during which he met the actors of the Indian film industry. The celebrities snapped a photograph with the Prime Minister to capture the unforgettable moment of their life. For the event, Vijay Deverakonda donned a green Bandhgala Sherwani, while Amit Sadh attended the meet in a khaki blazer and pants. Yami Gautam looked beautiful in a purple dress. At the event, PM Narendra Modi underlined India's transformation from dependence to self-reliance over the last decade, asserting that the dream of a developed India by 2047 can only be achieved through collective effort.Speaking at the TV9 summit, PM Modi said that India is no longer just a nation of dreams but one that delivers on them."We must reflect on the past to understand how India has progressed--from dependence to self-reliance, from aspiration to achievement. A decade ago, mothers and sisters were forced to limit themselves between sunset and sunrise for basic sanitation needs, but the Swachh Bharat Mission has resolved that," the Prime Minister said.Highlighting welfare initiatives under his government, PM Modi cited Ayushman Bharat as a solution to expensive medical care that plagued the poor in 2013. "In 2013, expensive medical care was a challenge, but Ayushman Bharat has provided a solution. Today, they have access to water from every household through 'Har Ghar Se Nal Jal.'"He also noted reforms in the taxation system, saying, "Our government uses every penny of taxpayers' money with honesty and also respects the taxpayers. The government has made the tax system more taxpayer-friendly.""In the last 10-11 years, India has transformed across every sector and progressed in every field--and this significant change has come from a shift in mindset. For several decades after Independence, a narrative was promoted in India that considered only foreign things to be superior," he added.Citing the evolution of India's banking landscape, he said, "Sixty years ago, bank nationalisation was implemented to ease access to services, but the reality was that many villages still lacked basic banking facilities. Today, we have transformed the banking landscape with online banking accessible from home and a banking touchpoint within 5 km of every area."PM Modi added that the country has not just improved infrastructure but also strengthened the banking system nationwide. Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri Wishes, Eid Messages and quotes !
column6: Today, they have access to water from every household through 'Har Ghar Se Nal Jal. Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri Wishes, Eid Messages and quotes !

column2: Haryana Cm Launches One-Time Settlement Scheme-2025 To Provide Relief To Traders
column5: File photo: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini (Picture credit: PTI) KURUKSHETRA: In a move aimed at easing financial stress on traders and boosting revenue, Haryana chief minister (CM) Nayab Singh Saini launched the One Time Settlement Scheme-2025 in Kurukshetra on Sunday. The scheme is designed to provide relief to thousands of small shopkeepers, traders, and entrepreneurs with pending tax dues.Speaking at the launch event, CM Saini said the scheme will allow taxpayers to clear their old dues and make a fresh start. "A simple and transparent tax system promotes economic growth. The One Time Settlement Scheme-2025 is a step towards that goal by freeing taxpayers from old financial burdens," said Saini.Under the scheme, taxpayers with outstanding dues up to Rs 10 lakh will receive a rebate of up to Rs 1 lakh. The scheme will remain open for six months. To make the process more accessible, the government has introduced three payment slabs based on cumulative outstanding tax amounts. For dues up to Rs 10 lakh, taxpayers will pay 40% of the balance after deducting the Rs 1 lakh rebate. For dues between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 10 crore, 50% of the outstanding amount must be paid. Taxpayers with dues over Rs 10 crore will have to pay 100% of the assessed amount. Additionally, those with dues above Rs 10 lakh can pay in two instalments.The CM highlighted that previous hurdles from the 2023 version of the scheme have now been addressed, including the removal of tax classifications and a complete waiver of penalties and interest. “This will reduce litigation, boost recovery, and improve revenue collection,” he added.Saini also announced several initiatives to ease compliance, including consolidated GST audits, installation of CCTV cameras in tax offices for transparency, and recommendations for GST rule reforms, such as automation of refunds and raising billing thresholds.Reiterating the government’s commitment to trader welfare, Saini shared updates on other support measures, including increased commissions for commission agents, incentives for rice millers, and the launch of trader welfare schemes under the MSME department.Senior government officials, local MLAs, and industry representatives were present at the event.
column6: File photo: Haryana chief minister Nayab Singh Saini (Picture credit: PTI) KURUKSHETRA: In a move aimed at easing financial stress on traders and boosting revenue, Haryana chief minister (CM) Nayab Singh Saini launched the One Time Settlement Scheme-2025 in Kurukshetra on Sunday. The One Time Settlement Scheme-2025 is a step towards that goal by freeing taxpayers from old financial burdens," said Saini.Under the scheme, taxpayers with outstanding dues up to Rs 10 lakh will receive a rebate of up to Rs 1 lakh.

column2: A Group Of Senators Slam Trump Administration Over Reported Plan To Share Sensitive Taxpayer Data
column5: File photo: US President Donald Trump (Picture credit: AP) A group of US senators have raised alarms over reports that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) are seeking unprecedented access to sensitive taxpayer data from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS).Senators Alex Padilla, Catherine Cortez Masto and Ron Wyden have released a joint statement: “This weekend, it became clear that the Trump Administration is finalizing plans to target and penalize people who are following federal law and contributing to our economy. This agreement between the IRS and DHS — if finalized — will have long-lasting and devastating implications on our economy, taxpayer privacy, immigrant communities, and the rule of law.” They have called upon the Trump Administration to make their plans public. The IRS and DHS must disclose the extent of this agreement and brief Congress immediately, they stated.Earlier, they, along with more than a dozen senators, had written to high-ranking officials in the DHS and IRS demanding transparency regarding any ongoing or planned data-sharing agreements.The senators pointed out that providing DHS with taxpayer addresses, phone numbers, and email addresses—particularly of undocumented immigrants using Individual Taxpayer Identification Numbers (ITINs)—could lead to the weaponization of the tax system against vulnerable communities. The lawmakers also condemned reports that DHS and DOGE officials sought to cross-reference IRS data with federal benefits databases, calling such efforts a blatant violation of Section 6103 of the Internal Revenue Code, which strictly protects taxpayer confidentiality.“Taxpayer data is subject to some of the strongest privacy protections under federal law. These safeguards were put in place after President Nixon used the IRS to target political enemies,” the letter stated. “If taxpayers believe their private financial information could be used against them, they will be less likely to comply with tax laws.”The letter also referenced concerns about the recent abrupt removal of William Paul as Acting IRS Chief Counsel. News reports suggest Paul was reassigned due to his resistance to breaking privacy laws. Lastly, the senators stated that granting DHS and DOGE access to taxpayer information could not only erode trust in the IRS but also negatively impact tax enforcement. They noted that IRS auditors are already stretched thin, and diverting them to investigate small businesses suspected of employing undocumented workers would take resources away from pursuing large-scale tax fraud and corporate evasion.
column6: File photo: US President Donald Trump (Picture credit: AP) A group of US senators have raised alarms over reports that the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) are seeking unprecedented access to sensitive taxpayer data from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS).Senators Alex Padilla, Catherine Cortez Masto and Ron Wyden have released a joint statement: “This weekend, it became clear that the Trump Administration is finalizing plans to target and penalize people who are following federal law and contributing to our economy. “If taxpayers believe their private financial information could be used against them, they will be less likely to comply with tax laws.”The letter also referenced concerns about the recent abrupt removal of William Paul as Acting IRS Chief Counsel.

column2: Sgst Overhaul: Now, Power Of Scrutiny Shifts From Officers To Commissioners
column5: Gurgaon: For ease of doing business and to benefit traders and businessmen in the state, govt has made changes to the Haryana GST Act to reduce unwanted scrutiny, notices and repeated audits, thereby preventing harassment of the business community. Under the new changes, which will be applicable from April 1, the power of scrutiny and issuing notices has been transferred to deputy excise and taxation commissioners (DETCs) from excise and taxation officers (ETOs).Withdrawal of certain powers from ETOs (inspector rank officers) and their transfer to a deputy commissioner rank officer is expected to bring accountability and reduce harassment of honest taxpayers. Setting up a panel of CAs for special audits, one-time settlement (OTS) scheme, installation of CCTV cameras in offices for transparency, changes in the system of (annual) audit, rebates up to 60% and waiver up to 100% (in certain cases) — these are among the key changes that may give relief to traders and businessmen. The state has introduced the OTS scheme, which will be implemented from next week. The scheme will be applicable to small taxpayers. Traders with pending dues of less than Rs 1 lakh will receive a 100% waiver. The state will waive off their tax, interest and penalty.For traders with pending tax dues of Rs 1 to Rs 10 lakh, the govt will give a rebate of 60% on the principal tax amount, interest and penalty. Around 1.5 lakh traders in this category will benefit.For traders with pending dues of Rs 10 lakh to Rs 10 crore, the state will give a rebate of 50% on the principal tax amount, interest, and penalty. In total, nearly 2 lakh small and medium traders and businessmen will benefit.GST expert and former chairman of NIRC of ICAI Naveen Garg said the transfer of power from lower-level officers to senior officers is expected to reduce the chances of harassment to traders and businessmen. "The commissioner rank officers have more knowledge and experience and they have a better understanding. It will increase accountability," said Garg, adding that the changes will increase the ease of doing business in the state and will also attract investment and businesses from other states.Garg said Haryana is the first state to make such changes, and it will encourage other states to bring in similar changes in their respective regions. He said the provision for installing CCTV cameras in the offices of ETO and DETC will also help in bringing transparency to the system.The govt has also made changes in the system of audit. Until now, traders and businesses had to undergo annual audits. Now, they will have to undergo audits once every four-five years. The state has decided to form a panel of CAs for special audits to be conducted on behalf of the department. "This will save time as it will reduce the number of trips to GST offices by traders and businesses," said Garg. He emphasised that the department is for collecting tax from tax evaders and checking irregularities, and it should not harass honest taxpayers.Under the GST law, taxes are calculated and collected based on self-declarations given by traders and businesses. However, the department has the power to scrutinise and issue notices to check for any tax evasion and irregularities. In cases where a notice is issued by the SGST, the business must pay upfront 10% of the tax amount for which the notice was issued before they can appeal against the notice. "This blocks the capital of the business and puts the burden of litigation and paperwork, which obstructs the business," CA Nimesh Vashisht said, adding that even if businesses get relief in appeal, the entire process wastes several months and creates hurdles for the businesses.From April 1, in cases related to tax collection of more than Rs 2 crore, the deputy excise taxation commissioner (DETC) will have the power to issue notices, whereas previously, the excise taxation officer (ETO) had this power. Similarly, the power of suo moto investigation (scrutiny) in cases of tax evasion was taken from the ETO and given to the joint excise and taxation commissioner. "The chief minister held a series of meetings with the CA association and other bodies to seek their suggestions in Jan. Changes have been made based on the suggestions and feedback given to the chief minister," a senior govt official said. He said that the objective is to make the state business-friendly.According to experts, these changes will increase the ease of doing business and attract new investments and businesses to the state. For the financial year 2024-25, the state has set a target of Rs 63,348 crore, and by March 12, 2025, the state has already collected Rs 58,693 crore.
column6: Setting up a panel of CAs for special audits, one-time settlement (OTS) scheme, installation of CCTV cameras in offices for transparency, changes in the system of (annual) audit, rebates up to 60% and waiver up to 100% (in certain cases) — these are among the key changes that may give relief to traders and businessmen. Around 1.5 lakh traders in this category will benefit.For traders with pending dues of Rs 10 lakh to Rs 10 crore, the state will give a rebate of 50% on the principal tax amount, interest, and penalty.

column2: Haryana Declares Restricted Holiday For Eid-Ul-Fitr On March 31 Citing Financial Year Closing
column5: Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini (PTI photo) NEW DELHI: The Haryana government on Thursday announced that Eid-ul-Fitr on March 31 will be observed as a restricted holiday (Schedule-II) instead of a gazetted holiday, citing the financial year closing."In partial modification of the Government Notification issued vide even number dated 26.12.2024, it is notified that Eid-ul-Fitr, i.e., 31st March 2025, shall be observed as a Restricted Holiday (Schedule-II) instead of a Gazetted Holiday, due to the fact that 29th and 30th March 2025 are weekend off days and 31st March being the closing day of the Financial Year 2024-2025," the government's notification read.Meanwhile, the Income Tax Department has also announced that its offices across the country will remain open from March 29 to March 31 to assist taxpayers in completing pending transactions before the fiscal year ends. The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) issued an order stating, "To facilitate completion of pending departmental work, all the Income Tax Offices throughout India shall remain open on 29th, 30th and 31st March, 2025." Since March 31 marks the last day of the financial year, all government payments and settlements must be finalized by that date. It is also the deadline for filing updated Income Tax Returns (ITRs) for the assessment year 2023-24. The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has issued a similar directive for banks handling government transactions to remain open on March 31 to accommodate taxpayers. "In order to facilitate accounting of government receipts and payments in the current financial year itself, necessary arrangements have also been made to conduct special clearing operations across the country," the RBI stated.Stay updated with the latest India news, weather, and Air Quality Index (AQI) updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.
column6: Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini (PTI photo) NEW DELHI: The Haryana government on Thursday announced that Eid-ul-Fitr on March 31 will be observed as a restricted holiday (Schedule-II) instead of a gazetted holiday, citing the financial year closing. The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) issued an order stating, "To facilitate completion of pending departmental work, all the Income Tax Offices throughout India shall remain open on 29th, 30th and 31st March, 2025."

column2: Unprecedented Tax Relief To Taxpayers In Budget, Says Fm Nirmala Sitharaman
column5: FM Nirmala Sitharaman NEW DELHI: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the Budget has provided “unprecedented tax relief to honest taxpayers” and is aimed at boosting domestic production and enhancing export competitiveness, while indicating that the Income Tax Bill to replace the 63-year-old law will be taken up for discussion during the monsoon session of Parliament.In Budget, FM had proposed a relief of up to Rs 1.1 lakh for taxpayers, hoping that more money in hands of people will spur demand.On Tuesday, the Lok Sabha passed the Finance Bill 2025 incorporating 35 amendments. In her reply to the discussion on the Bill, Sitharaman highlighted the changes in customs duties. “We aim to boost domestic production and enhance export competitiveness by reducing duties on raw materials and inputs, making domestic products more cost-effective,” she said. She also sought to address some concerns over power to access digital records proposed in the I-T Bill, said the records will also be taken into account. The current law permits the examination of books of account, physically kept or every manual record, which shows income expenditure.Since the 1961 Act does not mention the digital records, most often it becomes contentious and people go to the court and seek protection from not sharing passcode, she said. “So, digital becomes an issue. What prevails now with the gap and that gap is getting filled up in the new Income Tax Bill, which is before the select committee,” she said.The new Bill gives tax officers powers to override the access code of computer systems and virtual digital space, including online trading and investment accounts as well as cloud servers, in search and seizure cases.Now, the Budget will be taken up for discussion by the Rajya Sabha.Stay informed with the latest business news, updates on bank holidays and public holidays.Boost your business with AI. column2: Civic Bodies Extend Property Tax Office Hours To Boost Collections
column5: New Delhi: To help taxpayers settle their dues and boost revenue collection, civic bodies in Delhi have decided to keep their property tax offices open from March 29 to 31.The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) will facilitate interaction with tax officials regarding pending payments at its collection counters and tax office. Three payment counters will be open at Shaheed Bhagat Singh Place in Gole Market, Palika Bhawan in RK Puram, and Palika Kendra on Sansad Marg. These counters will accept payments from residents, service users, and electricity and water consumers within the NDMC area."NDMC's tax department at headquarters, Palika Kendra, will also be open from Saturday to Monday due to the end of the financial year 2024-2025 for the collection of property tax. Residents, taxpayers, and service users can also make their payment through online mode as per their convenience," said NDMC vice chairman Kuljeet Chahal.NDMC set a target of collecting Rs 1,150 crore through service tax for the financial year 2024-2025 and has already surpassed Rs 1,000 crore. The civic body issued 409 show-cause notices to defaulters and recovered Rs 60 crore from 80 individuals who had not paid taxes for 2-3 years.Similarly, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) will also keep its offices open over the weekend. As of now, MCD has collected Rs 2,054 crore, compared to a target of Rs 4,000 crore. The MCD has attached 88 properties across 12 zones and 87 bank accounts, recovering Rs 25.7 crore.Officials hope the extended hours will streamline the payment process and reduce the burden on taxpayers. Property owners are urged to make payments by March 31 to avoid penalties. Additionally, to improve the property tax system's efficiency, the MCD geo-tagged over 4 lakh properties by Nov out of the 13.29 lakh properties that were assigned Unique Property Identification Code (UPIC) numbers until the end of Jan. Officials said that from the next financial year (2025-26), geo-tagging will be mandatory and there will be no exemption.Stay updated with the latest city news, Air Quality Index (AQI), and weather updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

Residents, taxpayers, and service users can also make their payment through online mode as per their convenience," said NDMC vice chairman Kuljeet Chahal.NDMC set a target of collecting Rs 1,150 crore through service tax for the financial year 2024-2025 and has already surpassed Rs 1,000 crore.

column2: Pending Tax Work? Income Tax Department Offices To Stay Open On March 29-31
column5: Representative Image The Income tax department's offices across India will remain open from March 29 to March 31 to assist taxpayers in completing any pending tax-related tasks before the end of the fiscal year. The current financial year 2024-25 concludes on March 31.Despite the weekend and the observance of Eid-al-Fitr, which may coincide with Monday, the Income Tax offices will continue their operations, according to news agency PTI. The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) issued a directive stating, "To facilitate the completion of pending departmental work, all Income Tax Offices throughout India shall remain open on March 29, 30, and 31, 2025."As March 31, 2025 marks the final day of the fiscal year, and all government payments and settlements must be finalized by this date. Additionally, it is the last day for submitting updated Income Tax Returns (ITRs) for Assessment Year 2023-24.A similar notice has been issued by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) instructing banks involved in government business to remain open on March 31 for taxpayers' convenience.To ensure that government receipts and payments are properly accounted for within the current fiscal year, the RBI has also arranged for special clearing operations across the country.Stay informed with the latest business news, updates on bank holidays and public holidays.Boost your business with AI. column2: Centre Fixing Tax Demand Errors Faced By Goans Under Portuguese Code
column5: Panaji: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Wednesday that there has been a 470% increase over four years in the incorrect tax demands made on Goans who fall under the Portuguese Civil Code while filing income tax returns. She said that the income tax processing centre at Bengaluru is carrying out “suo-motu rectification” to ensure that taxpayers’ difficulties are resolved.Additionally, major steps have been taken to fast-track the disposal of pending appeals and strengthen guidelines on this issue, said Sitharaman.Section 5A of the Income Tax Act allows a couple governed by the Portuguese Civil Code to file income tax returns by equally dividing the income between the husband and wife. The same benefit applies to tax deducted at source.“CPC Bengaluru is carrying out suo-motu rectification to ensure that taxpayers in Goa are not unfairly burdened under the faceless regime,” said Sitharaman in a written reply to the Rajya Sabha.Rajya Sabha MP Sadanand Shet Tanavade raised the issue of Goan taxpayers facing difficulties due to non-division or incorrect division of tax deducted at source amounts between spouses.In 2021-22, there were 243 cases from Goa where erroneous tax demands were raised. According to the finance ministry’s data, this figure increased to 301 in 2022-23. In 2023-24, there were 1,076 cases, and the number continued to rise in 2024-25 to 1,388 cases.“The suo-motu rectification in almost all these categories of cases has already been carried out by CPC, Bengaluru,” said Sitharaman.The finance ministry said that eight different steps have been taken to fast-track cases.Of the 3,008 cases where tax demands were raised, suo-motu rectification has been carried out for 2,975 cases. Sitharaman said that rectification is pending in 33 cases, with some tax notices being appealed.Panaji: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Wednesday that there has been a 470% increase over four years in the incorrect tax demands made on Goans who fall under the Portuguese Civil Code while filing income tax returns. Sitharaman said that rectification is pending in 33 cases, with some tax notices being appealed.

column2: Punjab Minister Harpal Singh Cheema Directs Push For Gst Amnesty Scheme Participation
column5: 123 Chandigarh: Punjab finance, planning, excise and taxation minister Harpal Singh Cheema has issued a directive to maximise taxpayer participation in the GST amnesty scheme introduced for non-fraud cases. The minister emphasised the importance of proactive engagement through comprehensive public awareness campaigns, utilising traditional advertising and social media platforms to inform eligible taxpayers about the scheme's benefits.Chairing a meeting with senior officers of the taxation department at Punjab Bhawan, he stressed the need for sensitising the field staff to personally engage with taxpayers and facilitate the application process to "enable taxpayers to avail the benefits of the GST amnesty scheme and facilitate the recovery of revenue currently locked in arrears, thereby bolstering the financial health of the state."The scheme, introduced under Section 128A of the CGST Act, aims to ease the compliance burden on taxpayers by waiving interest and penalties on tax demands raised under Section 73. It allows taxpayers to clear their outstanding dues pertaining to the financial year 2017-18 to 2019-20 by March 31. Additionally, the corresponding forms must be submitted by June 30.He also issued a stern directive to all officers, mandating the attainment of established revenue targets without exception. During the meeting, the finance minister was briefed on the overall revenue growth, with a focus on Value Added Tax (VAT) and Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections.As per an official spokesperson, "VAT collection demonstrated a 5.74% increase, while GST revenue witnessed a more substantial growth of 13.39% up to Feb 2025. The divisions of Ludhiana and Amritsar were identified as key contributors to this success, exhibiting above-average performance in GST revenue collection."MSID:: 119427930 413 |

The divisions of Ludhiana and Amritsar were identified as key contributors to this success, exhibiting above-average performance in GST revenue collection.

column2: Taxpayers Told To Update Returns On Political Donations Before March 31
column5: Ahmedabad: The income-tax department has sent messages to thousands of taxpayers who had claimed deductions for donations to political parties under Section 80GGC of the Income-Tax Act for the financial year 2022-23. The department has asked to verify the claims and file updated returns with tax, interest and 25% penalty. However, tax experts said that this time, not only donors of registered unrecognised political parties (RUPP) but donors of big political parties have also received SMSes from the department.The I-T department has sent SMSes to thousands of taxpayers across the nation asking them to withdraw their claims of deduction for donations to political parties, said the experts.Karim Lakhani, a chartered accountant said, "The SMSes have been received by most taxpayers who had claimed deduction under Section 80GGC. Even those taxpayers who donated to big political parties have received such SMSes. Most taxpayers have receipts against their donations to registered political parties and they should not be worried if their donation is genuine. However, taxpayers, who had donated money to political parties, which came under search of the department, should file updated returns by March 31, 2025 so that they can avoid heavy penalty."As per the provisions of Section 139(8A) of the Income-tax Act, 1961, taxpayers can file updated returns on payment of additional tax as prescribed under law rectifying the errors within two years from the end of the relevant assessment year, he added. According to Lakhani, the department can reopen case for three years and five years from the assessment year based on tax evasion amount and in that scenario, the penalty can reach to 200%.Earlier, I-T department had carried out searches at multiple locations of registered unrecognised political parties (RUPP) and found that most of these parties used to give back cash to ‘donors' after deducting commissions for that amount and such ‘donors' used to claim deduction against such donations in their returns.

column2: Govt Seeks To Drop 6% Tax On Online Ads, Us Giants May Gain
column5: NEW DELHI: Govt proposes to abolish the 6% equalisation levy or digital tax on online advertisements from April, a move that will benefit advertisers on digital platforms, such as Google and Meta.The move is part of the amendments proposed by FM Nirmala Sitharaman and comes at a time when India and the US are engaged in steps to improve bilateral ties."Govt had removed equalisation levy of 2% on e-commerce last year. Although 2% levy garnered more criticism from the US, in anticipation of more tariff retaliation by US, govt is trying to show a more accommodative stance and removal of 6% equalisation levy on online advertising is a step in that direction," said Amit Maheshwari, tax partner at consulting firm AKM Global.Deloitte India partner Sumit Singhania said the move is in sync with endeavour to simplify the law. "Even from an international tax policy standpoint, most of the unilateral measures undertaken by govts around the globe in last several years to deal with tax challenges of digitalisation of economies have to be steadily wound back, to make way for uniform tax rules under two pillar solutions espoused by OECD. Given the context that preceded enactment of equalisation levy, this would be a progressive policy move to restore higher degree of certainty to taxpayers impacted by the levy," he said. Govt has also proposed amendments to make offshore fund investments less taxing and sought Parliamentary nod for changes related to tax assessments under search and seizure provisions and reconciliation of I-T returns."Key amendment is the replacement of term 'total income' with 'total undisclosed income'. In Finance Act 2024, when block assessment regime for search & seizure cases was introduced, 'total income' was used. This has caused concerns that in case of taxpayers facing search & seizure proceedings, even disclosed income will be subject to penalties. Now, govt has added a term 'total undisclosed income' to clarify that target is to penalise undisclosed income only," Maheshwari said.Stay informed with the latest business news, updates on bank holidays and public holidays.Boost your business with AI. column2: 4 Days Left To Avail Ots For 90% Waiver On Property Tax Interest: Ghmc
column5: Hyderabad: With just four days left for the end of the 2024-25 financial year, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has urged property taxpayers to avail of the One Time Scheme (OTS), which offers a 90% waiver on interest payments. So far, the tax collection under OTS has reached Rs 150 crore, while the total tax collection is Rs 1,720 crore.GHMC commissioner K Ilambarithi said that property tax can be paid online, through citizen service centres and e-Seva Kendras in the circle and headquarters, which will operate from 8 am to 11 pm. He also mentioned that residents can pay their taxes when collectors visit their homes and get the rebate on arrears. There is also an option to pay property tax through the MyGHMC app.Additional commissioner (finance) Anurag Jayanti suggested that the 90% rebate on accumulated arrears of property tax interest should be utilised by March 31, otherwise taxpayers will miss out on the opportunity.Stay updated with the latest city news, Air Quality Index (AQI), and weather updates for major cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Noida, and Bangalore on Times of India.

column2: Cbi Books 5 I-T Officials, Auditor For Extorting Taxpayers
column5: 12 Hyderabad: CBI has booked five Hyderabad-based income tax officials, a private auditor, and several unnamed individuals for allegedly extorting money from taxpayers by misusing official data and threatening them with penalties.According to CBI, an internal Excel list containing details of taxpayers claiming high refunds was circulated within the IT department on June 23, 2023. Although a senior officer later ordered its deletion, two accused officials — Quamar Aulam Khan and Manish Sikrawal — allegedly retained the data for personal gain. They contacted taxpayers directly via mobile phones, raising concerns about their income tax returns and threatening them with penalties.In collaboration with other IT officials — Gulnaz Rawoof, Kuthadi Srinivas Rao, and Mohammad Javeed — they sent emails from official addresses, instructing taxpayers to submit additional documents.Once contact was established, the accused allegedly demanded payments under the guise of "penalties." Auditor Pulimamidi Bhagat facilitated the extortion, receiving calls and coordinating payments from taxpayers. UPI transactions ranging from ₹20,000 to ₹1 lakh were traced to Bhagat, as well as to the accounts of the accused officials and their family members, as per the case.The FIR cites provisions under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, the Indian Penal Code, and the Prevention of Corruption Act.CBI is investigating charges of criminal conspiracy, cheating, and corruption after receiving consent from Andhra Pradesh govt to proceed with the probe.Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri Wishes, Eid Messages and quotes !

column2: Cag Finds Gst Refund Delays, Compliance Gaps In Gujarat
column5: Ahmedabad: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) flagged inefficiencies in Gujarat's Goods and Services Tax (GST) administration, citing delays in refund processing, oversight gaps in return filing, and lapses in transitional credit verification. The findings, presented in the Gujarat assembly, highlight significant revenue risks.The audit examined 1,262 refund claims between July 2017 and July 2020, revealing delays in 45% of acknowledgements, some stretching up to 385 days, while 15% of refund orders took as long as 347 days. Provisional refunds for zero-rated supplies faced delays of up to 44 days, according to the report.CAG also pointed out irregular approvals under the inverted duty structure, leading to incorrect refunds of Rs 91.17 lakh, and excess refunds of Rs 2.33 crore due to input tax credit (ITC) mismatches. Refunds were frequently issued without proper documentation, with some cases involving duplicate or time-barred claims.A major concern was the absence of post-audit checks, which resulted in double payments and unauthorised refund sanctions. The audit recommends stricter monitoring, enhanced compliance mechanisms, and a stronger grievance redressal system.Box: GST audit uncovers 466cr compliance gapsA subject specific compliance audit (SSCA) of Gujarat's GST department found compliance deficiencies amounting to Rs 466.40 crore. The audit, covering the 2017-18 period, assessed data inconsistencies, tax payments, and return filing processes. It examined 10 jurisdictional units, 385 high-value mismatches, and 50 taxpayers, finding discrepancies in management information system (MIS) reports on suo motu cancellations and REG-17 notices. Of the 385 inconsistencies identified, 145 cases (38%) revealed major lapses, including incorrect turnover declarations, ITC mismatches, and short tax payments. Additionally, granular taxpayer records were unavailable in 49 out of 50 cases, posing a potential revenue risk of Rs 319.92 crore.Box: 35.49cr transitional credit lapses CAG also flagged deficiencies in Gujarat's GST transitional credit verification, amounting to Rs 35.49 crore in non-compliance. Despite repeated requests, the department failed to provide records for 1,204 cases, preventing an assessment of the verification process. A sample audit of 86 cases across six divisions found non-compliance in 18 cases (20.93%), including excess ITC carry-forward, ineligible credit claims, and non-levy of interest on irregular credit usage. In 94% of these cases, VAT assessments were already finalised, indicating gaps in the verification process.Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Navratri Wishes, Eid Messages and quotes !

column2: Government To Abolish Equalisation Levy On Online Ads From April 1
column5: File photo  The central government has proposed to abolish the Equalisation Levy, or digital tax, on online advertisements, effective from April 1, 2025. This move is part of the 59 amendments to the Finance Bill presented by Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary in the Lok Sabha, which is expected to benefit advertisers on digital platforms like Google, X (formerly Twitter), and Meta.Introduced in June 2016, the 6% Equalisation Levy on online advertisement services was designed to tax digital advertising services provided by foreign companies. The Finance Bill amendment will remove this levy starting April 1, 2025, thus reducing the tax burden on digital ad consumers and platforms.The original Equalisation Levy focused on digital advertising services, including the provision of digital advertising space. In 2020, its scope was extended to e-commerce transactions, imposing a 2% levy on e-commerce supplies, which was abolished in August 2024.Experts suggest that the proposal to remove the 6% levy is part of India’s efforts to maintain a cooperative stance with the US, which had threatened to introduce reciprocal tariffs from April 2. Deloitte India Partner Sumit Singhania noted that the move aligns with the ongoing simplification of income tax laws in India.AKM Global Tax Partner Amit Maheshwari told PTI that while the 2% levy faced more criticism from the US, this decision reflects India’s attempt to address concerns from its trading partners, particularly the US, and ease tensions.Vishwas Panjiar, Partner at Nangia Andersen LLP, welcomed the move, highlighting that it provides certainty for taxpayers and addresses concerns over the unilateral nature of the levy raised by partner countries like the US.Along with the Equalisation Levy removal, the government has also proposed changes to ease offshore fund investments and amended provisions related to search and seizure assessments in tax mattersStay informed with the latest business news, updates on bank holidays and public holidays.Boost your business with AI.
